intro: Oligoneuron vossii, commonly known as the Voss's oligoneuron, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. The plant has small, opposite leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
